title: Living Beyond Our Means: Natural Assets and Human Well-being
summary: This statement was developed by the Board governing the MA process, whose membership includes representatives from U.N. organizations, governments through a number of international conventions, nongovernmental organizations, academia, business, and indigenous peoples.

title: Ecosystems and Human Well-being: General Synthesis
summary: This report presents a synthesis and integration of the findings of the four MA Working Groups along with more detailed findings for selected ecosystem services concerning condition and trends and scenarios, and response options.

title: Ecosystems and Human Well-being: Biodiversity Synthesis
summary: Prepared for the CBD, this report provides an overview of biodiversity across the assessment, organized around a set of 6 questions which were initially posed by the CBD to the MA.

title: Global Assessment Reports: Volume 1: Current State & Trends; Chapter 13. Air Quality and Climate
summary: The MA synthesized information from the scientific literature and relevant peer-reviewed datasets and models. It incorporated knowledge held by the private sector, practitioners, local communities, and indigenous peoples. The MA did not aim to generate new primary knowledge, but instead sought to add value to existing information by collating, evaluating, summarizing, interpreting, and communicating it in a useful form.
